column4: Q: ive added a ntfs hdd to my linux box (to share files form keeping the ntfs FS) would this cause ubuntu to have issues loading ?
i dont think so
a lot of users have more then one HD and more than one FS
sudo reboot works too
ye
!paste
its getting to where i would expect a gui to be, orange bar goes to end screen flickers then blank screen, i cant ssh into it either
local k/b doe snot respond either
hm, might have srewed the MBR (maybe there was one on the new HD ? )
their would have been but as it got past grub i wouldn't have thought it would cause an effect now
at this point*
true.   hm, maybe a Fschk on the new HD ?
er.   fsck
i dont have another machine to check the hdd on, ill remove it and see if i can get back in to ubuntu
you could try to log in Live CD ?
good point. ill do that first
as i have the box next ot me i removed hdd and it worked, gonna rty to re add it and hope if not live-cd next
x-loaded( well the gui) on that attempt, gonna look at hdd now strange but thanks for ya help
